Component.name: Button
Component.Description:
Physical push button that responds to physics collisions. Moves down when pressed and triggers an event. Used for interactive controls, puzzles, or any pressable surface.
Usage: buttonEntity.setComponent(Button(eventName = "door_open"))
Detecting press in a system: Query.where { changed(Button.id) and has(Button.id) } .eval().filter { it.getComponent<Button>().isDown } .forEach { handleButtonPress(it.getComponent<Button>().eventName) }
Physics setup required: - Button must have a Physics collider - Weight object must contact the button to press it
Attributes: - eventName: Event identifier sent when pressed (default "trigger") - isDown: Current pressed state (read by systems, set by ButtonSystem) - downOffset: How far the button moves when pressed (default 12mm down) - startPosition: Initial position, used to reset button
